features.name: Inevitability
entries: Whenever you target a creature with a Necromancy cantrip and miss with the attack roll or the target succeeds on a saving throw, the target takes half damage but no other effects.
Additionally, when you cast a Necromancy spell of 1st level or higher, add your proficiency bonus to one damage roll of that spell.

features.name: Improved Soul Harvest
entries: When you cast a Necromancy spell while you have temporary hit points, you can reduce your temporary hit points by up to twice your Charisma modifier.
Increase one damage roll of that spell by the amount of temporary hit points lost.

features.name: Necrosis Spellcasting
entries: Whenever you deal damage to one or more creatures with a Necromancy spell, choose one of the targets.
That creature takes an additional 1d8 necrotic damage, or 2d8 if the target is undead.

features.name: Grim Aura
entries: You emit an aura of death in a 10-foot radius while not incapacitated. Non-magical plants in this area wither.
Creatures of your choice in the aura can't regain hit points or become stable.
Once per turn, you can use a bonus action to target a creature within 30 feet. It must make a Constitution saving throw or become wreathed in miasma.
Until the end of the turn, the next time you damage that creature with a Necromancy spell, it is vulnerable to that damage.
You can use this once per long rest or expend a 4th-level spell slot or higher to use it again.
Reapers channel death like an artist commands their tools. They see beauty in the moment of demise and wield necrotic magic with precision and power.
